title: The Idea of time recurrence theory as it is reflected through the characters in Priestley's I have been here before
abstract: Time recurrence theory whieh is offered in . this play is an interesting topic to be diseussed since the play deals with time in an unusual way and it rejects the ordinary conception of time. An English writer, John Boynton Priestley, presents tine recurrence theory as the theme through the characters. Dr . Gortler as the main character, is a professor who is studying about time recurrence theory. He believes that he has come across an example of in order to verify his theory, he comes to Yorkshire inn in which the other characters spend the night for the weekend. In fact, the characters who stay at the inn undergo the problem of recurrence. In short, through Dr. Gortler-s intervention, the other characters become realize and change their view to become optimist. Then the thesis writer concludes that through time recurrence approach, the characters in the play may gain the optinism.
contributors: Stefanus Suprayitno (Advisor 2); Prof. Dra. Ester Harijanti Kuntjara, MA., Ph.D. (Examination Committee 1)
subjects: ENGLISH DRAMA-20TH CENTURY-STUDY AND TEACHING; PRIESTLEY, JOHN BOYNTON, 1894-1984. I HAVE BEEN HERE BEFORE-STUDY AND TEACHING
